Reviews.Title: Oh Canon, what have you done???
Reviews.Author: S. Scott
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I am a huge Canon fan boy. I brag about Canon like people brag about Apple or a Toyota Prius. I own two Canon DSLRs (5D and 40D) and several Canon point and shoots (including the S90 and SD800IS) and always recommend Canon to anyone buying a digital camera.I bought this camera for my wife to upgrade her SD800IS and chose it because of the large screen, big zoom, and HD video capability (all great features). After four days of shooting, I returned it. Read on ...The good.Photos in bright light = 5 stars (normal great Canon photos like you would expect). The photos in brighter light were all fairly good and the screen is large and looks great.Zoom = 5 stars. The camera zooms in/out REALLY fast which is great when you're trying to take pics of action shots or something that's moving fairly quickly. Loved having the big zoom.The not so good.Photos in low light (automatic mode) = 1 star. If the distance of your subject is more than about three feet, the camera would switch to shooting at 1/16th (bad) of a second and closer than three feet would shoot at 1/60th of a second (good). So when photographing my kids, that move frequently, many of the shots would blur because the shutter speed at 1/16th was just too slow. When I switched to program (manual) mode and put the flash to ON instead of to AUTO the camera switched back to 1/60 and the shots are fine but for an automatic user, this is awful when shooting subjects in the three to six feet range where the flash is still significant.Screen = 2 stars. While the screen is very large, I think it's using a resistive display which is what the original touch smart phones used (now all using capacitive). This requires much more pressure when touching the screen than say and iphone or android phone. The touch interface itself is also fairly clumsy and needs some work when navigating the menus. One nice feature is the ability to touch the screen anywhere in order focus to that point of the frame (like an iphone does which is great) but by holding that point a bit longer, it also fires the shot and takes the picture which caused quite a few accidental shots (not so great). Similarly, to take videos, you also press the video icon on the screen so if you have the camera in your lap (which we did at one point) you may end up taking a bunch of accidental videos of your lap (which we did several times).Battery = 1 star. I took the camera to Disneyland for the day and the battery lasted from about 8AM to about 3PM, that's all (compared to my 800IS that would last literally and entire trip). The battery itself is shaped like a tube and is smaller than a chapstick container. Not sure why they went with such a small battery when they have that big screen to power.Video = 1 star. The video was the actual deal break for me and caused me to return the camera. While the videos looked great, the sound was horrible. In one video, all you can hear is background noise and not the people that are talking that are only several feet from the camera. The camera also lets you zoom in/out when shooting video which is awesome; however, when zooming while videoing, you can hear the buzz of the lens moving in/out which is horrible. With all my other Canon cameras, I've never had any of these video issues.

Reviews.Title: Works for me
Reviews.Author: Harry
Reviews.Content: I have had this camer for about a week and so far, it has met or exceeded all of my expectations.  I bought it as an upgrade from a Canon PowerShot A710 IS that I have had for years and which has served me very well.  I bought the ELPH 510 HS primarily for the longer zoom and the more compact size.  The extra megapixels were not a big factor for me.  I have been experimenting with the camera and exploring the features and capabilities.  I have read the reviews and the complaints about short battery life.  The camera comes with a relatively low power battery (870mAh).  I was able to burn through that in an afternoon of playing with the camera, taking and viewing shots, video, etc. and hardly turning off the power at all.  I bought a pair of 1200mAh batteries for spares.  They provide almost 50% more power which should translate to more photos and video between charges.I am totally satisfied with the camera.  It is not a full size digital SLR, which I also considered.  But, I wanted a camera that I could keep with me that would give me more flexibility and better pictures than my smart phone.  While I am certain the full size camera would provide even more capabilities, it wouldn't do me any good if it was inconvenient to carry along.  This camera provides all of the essential, and many not so essential, features that I wanted.  It takes great pictures in nearly all lighting conditions.  The AUTO mode works pretty well for most shots.  I did, however, find that using some of the other scene modes can make a difference, i.e. using Kids & Pets mode when shooting pictures of the grandkids seems to speed up the focus process and results in a better picture. The video is outstanding, especially for the compact size of the camera.  I have read reviews claiming that you could hear noise from the zoom while shooting video.  I have not noticed that to be a problem.I like the touch screen.  It does take more pressure than my smart phone, but it is not problematic.  The menus are intelligently constructed and make it quick and easy to find what you need.  I love the way the switches work for powering on the camera, switching between shooting and viewing, and between snapshots and video.  The camera is always ready to do whatever you want.  The power on time is faster than my previous camera.  It is also faster between shots.  So, I have no complaints.The video diary feature is quite nice, but is limited to low resolution video. The same is true for some of the other rapid shooting features, like the five shot group where the camera picks the best shot, or the 8 shot burst, or the continuous shooting.  These features work well, but do not produce HD size images.  These are the only features of the camera that have not lived up to my hopes.I also did an accidental drop test on the camera.  I had it in my shirt pocket.  I dropped something else and when I bent down to pick up what I had dropped, the camera fell out of my shirt pocket onto a tile floor.  It powered on just fine and everything seemed to work just fine, but it seemed like it took the image stabilization a little while to reorient itself.  It has been working flawlessly since.One feature that I was looking forward to was the ability to control the camera from the TV remote when connected via an HDMI cable.  That does not work with my TV even though it has an HDMI CEC capability.  The camera user guide warns that this could be the case. So, I have to hold the camera and manually control it when sharing photos and video with the camera connected to the TV.  The full HD video is great.  No need to carry a separate video camera anymore.The bottom line -- This is a very capable, very compact camera that takes very good photos and video.  I am completely satisfied and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: On the fence still...
Reviews.Author: MKinz "Mindi"
Reviews.Content: First, let me say I purchased the Powershot 510 and the Powershot 310.  The 510 is a much more solid camera and a lot less plastic than the 310.  I think my two largest complaints and frustration comes with the touch screen and the 12 power zoom.  The touch screen drains the battery faster than my other Canon Powershot cameras and the zoom is incredibly difficult to get stable when at full 12 power and my pictures haven't turned out as well as I would like at that distance.  Overall, I really didn't like the Canon Powershot 310, so I am on the fence as to whether or not I will keep this one.  I have a few more days to think about it.  For now... here is a more detailed list of pros and cons:Pros:- Takes incredibly good photos with regard to color.- Easy to use.- The vivid setting is great for flowers and fall colors.- I love the fisheye effect without having to carry around my Canon DSLR camera and lenses.  I also love having the wide angle.- The miniature setting is kind of fun to use.- Feels incredibly heavy and solid, unlike the new 310.- Fits easily in my purse and pocket.Cons:- Can't stand having finger prints all over the screen when I go to take my picture.- Touch screen drains the battery pretty quickly over the other Canon Powershot cameras.- When zooming out, it is very difficult to keep it steady.Not sure what to order if I send this one back.  So, I am still on the fence, as I am partial to Canon cameras over Nikons.  The red color is not as it is shown in the picture.  It is more of a rust/burgandy color of red... it has a bit more brown to it, but I actually like it.UPDATE: 12/12/2011 - I ended up sending this one back and kept the Canon 310.  I am really glad I did.  I get a great battery life and when I compared the photos on this camera vs. the 510, the photos had better color and looked a lot more crisp from the 310.  I am happy with my decision.

Reviews.Title: Avoid this camara
Reviews.Author: Jay Goodier
Reviews.Content: I am a Canon fan. I have owned several of their pocket shooters and always recommend them to friends and family - and still do, just not this one.I purchased this camera with high hopes. On paper, the specs look great.. In reality, it falls short.-As with most point and shoots, the startup time to first image capture is slow. My SD1100 is faster.-Too many blurry images. The camera was either to slow to auto-focus or just never even bothered. I've never had this problem before with Canon, so I don't understand why this better processor would do this.-The touch screen is difficult to use. It is difficult to describe, but let's just say that it is nothing like the touch display on an iPhone.Not as big of a deal, but if you are still considering this camera, I will point out:-It is heavy. It is well made and sturdy with a big screen - this is bound to happen. The screen is nice though..-The battery didn't hold up as long as I thought it would. This may be because I had an Eye-Fi card in it, I am not sure.I would consider the Canon PowerShot SX230HS 12 MP Digital Camera with HS SYSTEM and DIGIC 4 Image Processor (Black) instead. Slightly better zoom and easier, non touch screen controls (and a little cheaper.)

Reviews.Title: Baffled By The Negative Reviews...
Reviews.Author: George Sawyn "GS"
Reviews.Content: I have had nothing but good results with the Elph 510, and I don't quite get some of the negative reviews. I bought the Elph 510 for my wife, and after seeing the results first hand, I decided to get one for myself.IMAGE QUALITY: The image quality is extremely good, in my opinion, and its high-ISO quality is very good. Before my first purchase, I checked the review at Steves Digicams, and looked at all of the sample photos, as well as some of the sample photos uploaded by users here on Amazon, and I found them to be very good quality.BATTERY LIFE: The review at Steves mentions the "poor" battery life, "only" 170 shots, and recommends getting a spare battery. If you're worried about battery life, check out the Power2000 compatible battery for this camera; it's available here on Amazon, and (at this moment) it's selling for $7.99 and free shipping. Its rating is 1200 mah, considerably better than the original Canon battery (870 mah). My wife and I both use these and keep the original Canon battery in our bags for spares. Power2000 ACD-326 Rechargeable Battery for Canon NB-9LTHE TOUCHSCREEN: Once again referring to the Steves review, the touchscreen is of a type that works better with a fingernail or stylus than with a fingertip, like the iPad touchscreen. My wife was worried about getting used to the touchscreen, but has gotten used to it and has no problem at all with it, and neither do I; the first camera I got with a touchscreen was the Canon SD980; it worked just fine, and so does this one.My wife and I both wanted to find a nice, compact camera with big zoom, and the Elph 510 fits our needs perfectly; we are both very happy with it. When I have some spare time, I'll be uploading some sample shots.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 510 HS
Reviews.Author: R. Garay
Reviews.Content: Don't give much thought to the negative comments about this camera. Canon did an excellent job with this model. Read the directions and make the necessary changes and you will be very satisfied. The touch screen only requires calibration to your touch and it will respond just fine. Read and follow the directions! The pictures and video are excellent and the low light setting works great. Read and follow the directions!! Sound is great. Overall, a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great photos
Reviews.Author: N. Miller "Tiffany's mom"
Reviews.Content: This camera is super.  I love the way it captures the light.I have taken photos with this that are similar to others and it produces great photos.the touch screen takes a bit of getting used to, I now love it.  less buttons!it is compact for a camera with such a great zoom!I would purchase this camera again... and do recommend it to my friends.I purchased it when it was list price, now it is a super price.

Reviews.Title: didnt like the touch screen
Reviews.Author: skizha "skizha"
Reviews.Content: Jay Goodier's review covered it all.. i dont have anything more to say really.. returned  it and purchased an SX230HS because i felt the touch screen of ELPH510 is more of a nuisance than actually helpful. It is not even intuitive. Good old button controls are better. Plus SX230 is cheaper, lighter and thinner.ELPH510 is technically thinner than the SX230 but thats because the SX230 thickness is measured including the slightly projected lens. otherwise the SX230 body is thinner and is lot more comfortable in the hand. And I loved the 14x zoom of SX230. It performs very well, gives amazing results and no complaints so far.Giving the ELPH510 3 stars because its not so bad, not so good either.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I ever had!
Reviews.Author: Donny
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I buy a lot of stuff at Amazon and NEVER write reviews. This camera is AWESOME! I bought this camera for the 12X optical zoom and was concerned about the picture quality because the camera is so small. I was blown away by the quality of the pictures. I just went on vacation and took over 700 pictures in every condition imaginable and the pictures are unbelievable. BUY this camera. It is the cheapest camera I ever bought and the Best camera I ever bought. You'll love it!

Reviews.Title: Cannon Elph
Reviews.Author: Tracy Lynn Troike
Reviews.Content: I love my little Elph.It has a fantastic zoom and takes great indoor and outdoor photos. Not the greatest for the dark or action shots, but compared to other small pocket cameras, this one is pretty dang good. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Canon ELPH 510
Reviews.Author: SteveQ
Reviews.Content: Really nice camera.  Great pictures and very good HD videos. I really like the red-eye correction feature built into the camera.  Touch screen and "tap to advance" are also nice features.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: Overall I like this camera. It has some cool features, but most importantly it works. Touch screen is not as good as a smart phone, but I have yet to encounter a camera touch screen that is any different from this one. touch to select focus point in the image. The battery is small, but extras are cheap. Comes with battery, charger, lanyard strap, camera. does NOT ship with an SD card, but those are also cheap.I purchased this with an extra 1200mAh battery that fits the charger and the camerahttp://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0048AVBNS/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00I also use this with a 32GB C10 Sandisk SD card. They can be found on amazon for around $25 to $35, and will hold about 9000 pictures.Seems fragile, so be careful about dropping it (use the strap on your wrist!)

Reviews.Title: Powerful camera. Terrible touchscreen.
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: Despite the lack of need for a point-and-shoot camera with the proliferation of smartphones, this camera may not be that useful. But there are those who still use dumbphones or have terrible cameraphones. I have a Canon DSLR, but it is too cumbersome to tote around, so I wanted a more portable camera.It's hard to believe that all the features are packed into this little thing. The images and videos are quite good. There are various settings, but let's be honest - people who'd buy this camera want simplicity, and the auto setting does well. The shutterlag is significantly longer than the DSLR, but that's to be expected. And it's not too bad.The HUGE letdown is the awful touchscreen which is not that responsive like iPhones, Android phones or iPads. It's so annoying. I like the buttons. The scrolling is terrible. I never want to adjust the settings because it's so annoying to fumble through. The ONLY good thing about the touchscreen is the incorporation of video by touching the red circle for recording video. The rest of the touchscreen gizmo sucks. I'm sure that contributes to the decrease in battery life.I was torn between this one and the ELPH 310 HS which does not have the touchscreen and something I already preferred. But the ELPH 310 HS is only 8x optical zoom which is still decent, but not 12x like this one. I can't say no to more optical zooming, so I took the plunge to the touchscreen display. I don't regret my decision of choosing the 510 over the 310 because of the zoom, but the touchscreen is worthless. Thank goodness this camera didn't try to incorporate wifi - I can imagine how annoying that might be.I bumped this up to 4 stars because the camera itself captures wonderful images which is the #1 function of a camera, but that touchscreen nearly makes this a 3-star item. Hopefully you'll find the perfect setting so you won't have to tweak much. It would've been better to upgrade the 310's zoom to 12x and keep it simple.

Reviews.Title: Not Canon's best
Reviews.Author: CGScammell
Reviews.Content: I am an admitted Canonphile.  I have a lot of Canon cameras. I bought this one recently when it was offered as a lightning deal.As with most Canon products, this camera takes good photos.  Colors are vibrant and true.  I don't see abarations or other annoying flaws.  But one thing does annoy me and it's the short life of its battery.  I needed three batteries while walking around Chicago yesterday taking 600 photos.  This is unacceptable!  I can see two batteries, but three?Apparently a lot of energy is spent on the touchscreen, which I also find annoying.  It's either too sensitive or not sensitive enough.Be prepared to buy extra batteries, or get used to cutting down on your picture taking with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Janice
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this product. User friendly, it takes great, clear, sharp photos. I just recently went to Costa Rica and the quality of the pictures was awesome (not to mention CR!!) I am not tech-saavy but this is an easy camera for me to use ... just point and shoot, however, there are some aps that make for some fun photo-shooting too, like the fish-eye and color enhancement features. Decently priced, too.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot Elp 510 HS
Reviews.Author: elp
Reviews.Content: This camera appears to fit all my needs to take quality pictures & video.  I'm no expert but the camera is easy to use, is loaded with features (read the book to fully enjoy it) and the software to download your work is straight forward and user frendly not like some other brands I have used.  The touch screen can be a little touchy but that should improve with use.  Good product.

Reviews.Title: It takes great pictures... when it's working
Reviews.Author: Deb Hall "Deb"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on a long awaited trip to New Zealand.  Less than two months later the shutter was not fully opening, so the upper left and lower right side of nearly all the pictures I took in New Zealand had to be cropped.  Because I use my camera a lot, it was not until several months later that I contacted cannon and arrange to get it in for repair.  I was initially told it was (as it should have been) under warranty.  Then I received an email, saying the repair would cost $163.46.  Since I had paid less than $200. for the camera, this was ridiculous, not to mention they were ignoring the copy of my Order Detail for the purchase from Amazon.  If I had not called and protested, Canon would not have made good on their warranty.Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: This is a superb point and shoot camera!
Reviews.Author: Bob Tobias "Robert Tobias"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera to replace our Canon PowerShot ELPH 100 HS which died a premature death after being submerged during a rain storm (actually a deluge) at an outdoor Macy Gray concert.  But, enough about me, let's talk about this camera...Optics:The optics are remarkable.  Most people "focus" on the 12x optical zoom which *is* pretty remarkable.  It is made even better by the effective built-in image stabilization.  What I find at least equally useful is the "wider than usual" wide angle.  For example, it allows me to get more into a picture when I'm in a small room.Images and Video:The pictures, both stills and videos are crystal clear.  I also like that I can zoom while shooting videos.  Auto White Balance is correct, focusing is quick and also spot on, and automatic exposures are remarkably accurate.  Performance in low light is very good (for a camera in this class).Convenience:The camera is small, light, and durable (though it probably couldn't stand being submerged either).  The large display makes it more enjoyable to review pictures and videos while they're still in the camera.  The functions I need, got example flash on/off, and scene selection are readily available.The more esoteric functions... because of the touch screen using them can be a bit cumbersome.  However, if you're like me then you never use them with this kind of camera so it's not an issue.Final Thoughts:There are a number of limitations that apply to this camera (as well as other "small" cameras in the < $500 price range): - It's a small camera with a small flash.  You are not going to light an auditorium full of people with it.  However, it does a great job in a dimly lit space for people that are nearby as well as filling in shadows in bright sunlight. - The shutter response is a bit slow for effectively capturing children and pets.  The trick for doing that is to either practice and improve your timing or buy a more expensive and probably larger camera. - As mentioned above, precise manual controls are available but difficult to get to.  If you *really* expect to need these functions then you should probably consider other cameras.Finally, if you want a camera that you can carry with you without a second thought, have ready to take pictures in the blink of an eye, and be confident the images will be accurate in just about every situation without having to adjust anything then this camera is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable camera, six stars
Reviews.Author: keeting "zerak"
Reviews.Content: We decided to roll the dice and try the touch screen (510) over the newer model and are very pleased.  This is an amazing little camera. The 12x zoom works well due to the stability feature and the automatic and presets make taking great pictures a snap. I've had other cameras that were very difficult to figure out even with a manual.  The on-screen functions and menus are very easy to follow which is good because the 200+ page manual is available as a pdf only.  The in camera processing is also pretty amazing.  We heeded others comments about the battery life (or lack there of) and purchased the recommended extra-life off-brand product.  Good thing!  Otherwise, this camera lives up to the great reviews it has recieved.

Reviews.Title: Battery is not good
Reviews.Author: Vaibhav
Reviews.Content: This camera is cool and I used it extensively in last 30 days. Only problem is with battery, its too week. After 100+ snaps using zoom and all, battery discharges.I ordered for one set of backup battery.

Reviews.Title: Canon ELPH 510 HS
Reviews.Author: David Chu
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a trip. Did not read the guide before the trip.This camera has a lot of features, too many to just guess at how it works.What I figured out works really well.

Reviews.Title: Canon Elph 510 HS
Reviews.Author: Connie
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in March.In May appproximately one-third of the time the camera refused to focus when I attempted to take a picture. After turning it off and on a number of times, it would eventually focus. The Canon support center had me restore the camera to factory de-fault settings. After another 15 photos,it refused to focus again. By this time my 90 days were up so it was not returnable. I now have to send it to Virginia to see if I have to pay to have it repaired. The Canon support center did not have a clue what was wrong with it. I told a saleman at Best Buy what was happening and he immediately diagnosed it as an Auto Fovus Servo issue.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera with good zoom
Reviews.Author: Alice F
Reviews.Content: We've had this camera for a few years now and it still works great. I don't tinker with manual settings, and I have been pleased with the various shooting modes. (I have not used all of them)What I love:- small size- good, powerful zoom without a bulky lens- nice colors- good night scene pictures- high-quality video images (not sound)- works fine with Vivitar replacement batteryWhat I don't like so much:- rather long delay between pushing the shutter button and the picture actually being taken- long delay between pushing the record icon for a video and the actual start of the video (missed quite a few opening notes to my son's songs)- serious distortion when shooting with the wide angle lens

Reviews.Title: Meh! Canon could have done a LOT better for what they were charging for this camera!
Reviews.Author: SysAdmin/Babysitter "SysAdmin/Babysitter"
Reviews.Content: 1- Uses Canon batteries only, buy spares if you plan to shoot all day without charging.2- Photo quality is good.3- LCD screen is not so good in BRIGHT daylight.4- Video is saved in Quick-time format (some devices do not support format).

Reviews.Title: Battery dies very quickly!
Reviews.Author: Samantha Taylor
Reviews.Content: The camera is a good camera but the battery dies quicker then any camera I've ever had.  Am returning it becuase of this....

Reviews.Title: Run, do not walk, from this product!!
Reviews.Author: Cally "Cally"
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the worst purchases I've ever made.  The lense is defective, it won't work, and I am out two hundred bucks.  Busy with work, I made the horrid mistake of not trying this product out right when it arrived.  When I finally did try it out, it would not work.  I am now out the money and regretting ever buying this thing.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Jeff J Tesar
Reviews.Content: awesome large, 3.5 inch smart phone-type touch screen.  Great zoom.  However, in automatic mode, the indoor photos are not good; you need to change to manual and put the right settings to get a better quality photos

Reviews.Title: No so great after 4 months
Reviews.Author: william H
Reviews.Content: Bought this in April for a NYC trip. worked good for the first 4 months then the battery wont charge or hold a charge. I called Canon and they say to send it back to look at it. 2 weeks later I get a letter saying that it will cost me $165 to have "it" repaired, they never say what is actually wrong with the camera only that it is not covered under warranty. I only paid $225 for the camera. Never again for a Canon

Reviews.Title: not what I expected...
Reviews.Author: ZEVA
Reviews.Content: Good size, good touch screen, good zoom but bad picture quality... Im a Canon fan. I have other big format cameras and they are awesome thats what I blindly trusted this product. Pictures are always blury even from static objects. Flash doesn't work well either. Not a good option for pocket cameras.

Reviews.Title: Sells its Elph!
Reviews.Author: Amazombie
Reviews.Content: Purhchased this older version Elph 510 based on Amazon reviews and the fact that I've had Canon Elphs since they were first introduced.  Before taking a twelve day cruise, I was sure to purchase four extra (ClearMax) batteries to be ready for anything.  Will say that with a great deal of zooming in and out and averaging about 250 shots a day, I went through two to three batteries a day, charger works great.  Be aware that Amazon likes to recommend purchasing a case for this camera that is too small, so check the sizes of what they are offering.  I paid less than four dollars for a case that now holds my batteries, but luckily I had a beltloop case from my older Elph that sized out the same as the 510.  After four thousand photos I'm very pleased with the quality of the camera, screen function, photos, and price.

Reviews.Title: It is toooooooooooooooooooooo slow.
Reviews.Author: Carol Johnston
Reviews.Content: The subject is in the next room before you can even get a shot off.  I am really disappointed in this product and am sending it back.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Claudia A. Inoue
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before ordering this camera....I must say, I love love love this camera.VERY user friendly! Absolutely FANTASTIC battery life!!!!Small and lightweight, I carry it with me all the time....SO EASY to switch from taking a picture to making a video.I would totally recommend this camera to someone who wants to point and shoot....but it also has a bunch of fun features that I am just beginning to explore!

Reviews.Title: Arrived late but works good
Reviews.Author: Bert
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I am not a photography expert.  I take pictures to remember where I have been.  Well, a little more than that, I like to create photo files of trips and events to reflect back on when I am not travelling.  This camera is extremely easy to carry and so I usually carry it on my belt.  I have taken at least 500 pictures and they all look great.  I did purchase the extra batteries and have not had to use them within any one day, but they are convenient to swap and charge later when the battery is low.

Reviews.Title: Performs well above what I had hoped
Reviews.Author: Patrick S Doell
Reviews.Content: I picked out this camera because I was unsatisfied with the results of our pocket Sony camera when taking photos of my kids at youth soccer and basketball. Our Sony camera is a fine camera and takes great photos as long as the subject is not moving. I had really wanted to buy a D7000 DSLR but that just wasn't in my current budget. I was a little worried about some of the negative reviews that I read on the 510 but there were so few of them and the price with it being an older model was just too good not to take a chance on it. So far I have taken shots at two soccer practices and the results have been fantastic. I took shots of my daughter practicing punts and was blown away with how many clear frames the camera was able to produce in burst mode (freezing the ball perfectly in multiple frames). Also took some action shots of the kids and dogs and have gotten nothing but great comments on facebook. It would be better to have a better zoom rate but I knew that going in. I have read some complaints about the touch screen and I guess it could be improved on but in my opinion it is suffecient to operate the camera.Another feature I like about this camera is there is an easy to use switch to go from the custom settings to fully automatic. I had never given that switch much thought until the other day when my wife's cameras battery was low and she wanted to borrow mine. I had messed her up in the past by changing the settings on her camera when I used it, and her not knowing how to get it back to the automatic mode that she prefers to use.

Reviews.Title: Super and talented little camera.
Reviews.Author: Sherlock33
Reviews.Content: Although I also own a Canon Powershot s5 iS, I wanted to get a versatile camera that I could just slip into a pocket at those times that I didn't want to carry the larger one. The ELPH 510 seemed like a good choice from similar types available. After using it now for a couple of months, I'm delighted by everything about it. For a camera of this size, its versatility is amazing, and I really love the touch screen.  It's hard to believe that Canon could cram all the features they did into a camera this size.  The zoom is excellent, the quality is excellent, and the little bugger takes dandy HD videos. Don't know how they do it! Recommended (obviously).

Reviews.Title: Elph 510 Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: bndebt
Reviews.Content: Great little point and shoot camera. Very good color, even in low light.  I had a Fujifilm F550exr, did not use the GPS on it, had trouble focusing in lower light movies.  EPLH510 shoots very good outdoors of in low light. Nice zoom too.

Reviews.Title: Great images
Reviews.Author: Jessica L. Morel "medx2b"
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera. I have had it for two months now and am trying to figure out the right settings for the lighting but that's more of a user issue than one with the camera. When reading reviews before buying I saw a lot of complaints about the touch screen. I however, find it very intuitive and easy to use. With all the touch screen phones now I can hardly see how anyone is complaining about it. I bought one for my brother in black at the same time and he has had no issues with his either. The zoom is great. I had an older elph (approx 8 years older and only 6 mega pixels) and if this one holds up and takes the beating that my last on did then I think we are good to go. My last elph was dropped from about 9 feet onto bricks and other such tumbles and still works just fine. I upgraded for the newer technology and so far it seems the quality of the elph products has remained high over time.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Scott J.
Reviews.Content: I have been looking at cameras for several months and finally saw this one and couldn't say no to it.  It has a 28mm wide angle lens and can take some amazing pictures and videos.  Once you master all the different type of settings on it, you can really take some amazing pictures.  It has a very simple to use user interface touchscreen  with about 24 different mode settings.  One of the main reasons I bought this camera was for HD video and scenery pictures, both of which it does an amazing job at.  It also has a video setting to record 240 FPS and replay them back to you at 60 fps, making it super slow motion, which is probably one of the coolest features.  Although it does not work very well in low light (expected) it still can capture some amazing stuff.  If you are looking to take pictures in low light, there are settings for that, and they turn out incredible. So good in fact that I hardly ever use the flash.  The only time that is needed is when its too dark to see at all!I read some other reviews which mostly said this model has a short battery life and this is definitely true.  I preemptively purchased a couple extra batteries and a car charger for them, so I will never be left with a dead battery.  If you are interested in doing this the battery model is listed in the camera specs.or here is a good optionhttp://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004GI6PCY/ref=oh_details_o02_s00_i00Camera is kind of heavy for a point and shoot, but the camera

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: TLH
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera takes awesome picture very clear! Would defiantly recommend. Very easy to use. Nice and small will fit in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: CANON POWERSHOT DIGITAL CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Doris Fish "FISHOFTENNESSEE"
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA IS A BIG CAMERA IN A SMALL PACKAGE.  TAKES SUCH GREAT PHOTOS AND SMALL ENOUGH FOR YOUR PURSE.  SO PLEASED WITH IT AT SUCH AN INEXPENSIVE PRICE TAG

Reviews.Title: Took lousy pictures. Maybe an anomaly?
Reviews.Author: pga
Reviews.Content: Most reviews sounded good, but the ELPH 510 specimen that I received took really bad pictures. There was a "pale spot" in the middle of each picture (i.e., really low contrast, just in that spot). Also, the pictures were generally blurry and did not have good coloring. I've returned this one - time for me to give some other company a chance.

Reviews.Title: Broke After a Year and a Half
Reviews.Author: Noseybody
Reviews.Content: I bought the Canon 510 for my 13 year-old daughter, who is far more concerned with the form and "coolness" of the camera than she is with the functionality or quality of the photos.  The touchscreen is definitely cool, and the options to edit pictures directly are a lot of fun.However, the lens broke after about a year and a half of occasional use.  Now, the lens does not retract all the way into the body of the camera, and my daughter can no longer take new pictures.  She can still view the pictures that already exist in the memory card on the screen.  Canon wants $155 to repair the camera, which is almost as much as I paid to buy the camera new.I have had much better experience with Olympus, GE and Panasonic brand cameras, at least with regard to the durability and longevity, and I would be inclined not to try Canon again.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic.
Reviews.Author: Aramat
Reviews.Content: I bought one for myself a year ago, and recently bought another one for my mom. It is a fantastic high end amateur camera for the price, with a lot of functions, and if you master them you will become much better photographer. When ordering camera order extra batteries. This camera comes with a very weak battery that has a short life. If there was a battery rating for this specific one, I would give 0 stars.I love this camera, great buy, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Joe F
Reviews.Content: We took this as our only camera on a 3 week trip to Indonesia. The anti-shake capabilities are amazing--I was able to take crisp photos at night at full zoom. The automatic mode works well, and I used several of the program modes for special situations. The only issue we had is that the camera really drains the battery. I bought extra batteries because of reviews that I read, but the one time I forgot to charge them at night and started with a partially drained battery, I ran out of juice. The camera is heavier than most point and shoots, and you have to get used to the touch screen--my wife would lay her thumb on it and start taking movies without meaning to. However, with these caveats, I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for everyday use!
Reviews.Author: Leslee Johnston
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a little over a year ago.  The only thing I would change is the battery - it is an odd size/shape.  You cannot pick up a second battery charger if you forget to pack yours.  The photos are really high quality (I have had mine enlarged to as big as 11X17 without loss of resolution).  The settings are easy to understand and change.  The touchscreen viewer can be a bit hard to use at times, but there is always the old reliable push button on top.

Reviews.Title: OMG
Reviews.Author: Bargain Bounty Hunter
Reviews.Content: This is so much better than the 150 dollar sony camera that we had.  Takes crisp clean pictures even in fast action. Movie quality is outstanding. My old camera would constantly refocus and get blurry and you could hear the camera zooming and focusing constantly. Not with this camera.  Well worth the money. We aren't missing any cute shots of our kids now.  Takes pictures reasonably quick with minimal delay. When my kid smiles, I get the picture now. No more waiting 3-5 seconds for the camera to decide to take a picture.Update: on the third use of the camera, having it in my pocket, the LCD screen cracked. there was no impact of any kind so be careful and use cautiously

Reviews.Title: Great photos for the novice photographer
Reviews.Author: Laura M McIntyre
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera with some options as I've recently come to enjoy photography, but I wasn't ready to invest in an SLR camera.  I did my research with the help of Consumer Reports magazine, and this was a perfect fit.  The small size is perfectly portable, which means I can take it anywhere.  And I really like all of the different modes, timer, etc. and plan to use them all.  I love the size of the touchscreen on the back, which is huge, and the ability to crop photos right on the camera and then upload them to Facebook or another website easily.  The only thing I wish is that the hole on the bottom to attach it to a tripod weren't so close to the battery and memory card slots, as it makes it impossible to leave the connecter for my tripod attached.  Since I don't plan to use the tripod everyday though, it's not something that inhibits my love of every other feature of this camera.

Reviews.Title: A little awkward to manipulate
Reviews.Author: Will read for fun
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong . . . the pictures are great . . . but zooming in to look at a specific part of a picture isn't easy to do.  Other than that, I really like this camera.

Reviews.Title: User Friendly
Reviews.Author: Rosalind D. Guttman "MizRoz"
Reviews.Content: I do like the user friendliness of Canon cameras. The manual is easy to read.My pictures look (almost) professional! :)

Reviews.Title: Great Deal!
Reviews.Author: HAMM "muttly"
Reviews.Content: Got this on a lightning deal at Christmas. LOVE it! Battery lasts and lasts--which is great for the occasional picture takers that we are, since we forget to recharge. Also takes consistently better pictures than my much larger lens on my Casio--especially indoors. VERY happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Sherbondy
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera.  We had larger 12mp camera but this smaller one takes better videos and is much lighter.  I don't know if I like the rechargeable batteries as much as the AAs for electronic devises I used on the other camera.  The video also picks up a lot of sounds so the person taking the video will have to watch how loud they talk.We do not own a SLR.  If we did this might get less use but because it is small it is still a great choice.  Also does HD videos.Seller was great; shipped very fast.  I would buy this camera again and plan to use it as our main camera.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: I read the small booklet that comes with the camera but I still haven't mastered it yet.  Suggest that you play with it for a good while before taking serious photos.  The large screen is nice.  The touch screen is not all that user friendly and is a little slow to respond to touch.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Camera
Reviews.Author: deb
Reviews.Content: Great photos, easy to use, great size.  We bought the Case Logic TBC-302 FFP Compact Camera Case (Black) and it is a perfect fit!  Couldn't be happier!  And if you don't know Canon has amazing great customer service!

Reviews.Title: elph 510
Reviews.Author: chuck elliot
Reviews.Content: i love the automatic exposure feature - with the manual override option. i love the index feature - viewing multiple images at a time. i dislike the fact that the battery needed to be recharged every couple days when i only took a few shots.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: HGmusic "Guitar Man"
Reviews.Content: After going through most of the functions, I believe this will be a good digital camera/video.  Like most products, the user guide is very small print, however, the install cd has a pdf version.Will update this review after I have used the camera for a while.

Reviews.Title: May return it
Reviews.Author: George Skyles
Reviews.Content: I may return it. It doesn't have an eyepiece, which is my preferred to see my photo subjects. (The screen, in high light, reflects and makes seeing the subjects difficult.) Also, I am speculating that the specialty battery may be difficult or expensive to replace.

Reviews.Title: This is very good camera
Reviews.Author: Dilip Pandya
Reviews.Content: Nice camera and very good pictures and LCD display. Has safety feature of auto close when not able to open lens properly. Good value for money item.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: Wayne R. Beal
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  The zoom is very sharp and the images blow up quite well.  It makes excellent macros.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic all round camera
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: Has some super features, excellent LCD, and take great photosWe travelled for three months in China, Vietnam & Cambodia, took hundreds of photos and the results were as good as an SLR

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 510 HS 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Joe Mama
Reviews.Content: The camera takes great photographs and is very easy to use.  The touch screen doesn't seem as responsive as we've come to expect from modern smartphones or tablets but it's not awful.  I purchased it as a gift for a family member and they love using it.  Not many manual controls, but a great point & shoot.

Reviews.Title: Just like it says it is
Reviews.Author: Laurie Stevenson
Reviews.Content: Nice size for my small hands. Easy to focus. Screen is nice size. Features abound. Would recommend for vacationers to have

Reviews.Title: Sharp lens with wide enough aperture to produce shallow depth of field.
Reviews.Author: M. Jenner "use the spell check"
Reviews.Content: Love the tap focus on the big screen. This lens is sharp and what a range, 24mm-335mm equivalent, alright. I got this for my boyfriend, but I'm always grabbing it away from him to take shots. Amazon notified me it was on sale, some kind of special deal so I got one. What a nice surprise, it's terrific. Not keen on the tap to take photo, but the tap focus is great. It's supposed to do 1:1 ratio, but I can't find it in the manual or the menus. Hardly any buttons, so all settings through menus. That part I'm not crazy about since I'm used to my G10. I've owned lots and lots of cameras, and I must say the Canon P&S; cameras are the best, that and Ricoh if they could get the noise down. But, Canons are almost all good. They need to be careful with the compression algorithms. I got a smaller Canon that could not save RAW files and I was seeing all kinds of artifacts at 100% in Photoshop; had to sell that one. But, this model is pretty nice. It's a bit hard to hang onto though, could have used a grip. It's also quite heavy and a bit large, could be pocketable, but maybe just.

Reviews.Title: Great with light, struggles in the dark. Nice HD video.
Reviews.Author: Trent
Reviews.Content: Great for outdoors and HD video and well-lit indoor shots. Slow to auto-focus and blurry/grainy in low light. Nice set of presets/effects. Wish the super-slo-mo recording setting had higher resolution. Macro/zoom seems to require a long distance to the subject, but the 4000x3000 resolution allows for some cropping afterward.

Reviews.Title: Excllent choice
Reviews.Author: Motaz A. Moniem
Reviews.Content: Amazing features in a very small compact size device. I’m happy from my purchase.My only take on this camera is battery indicator. There is no battery indicator. Your indicator will only flash when your battery is low.. Other than that.. Wow.. Be sure to have a little bit of a firm touch…

Reviews.Title: Really love this camera!!
Reviews.Author: viola
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for me who wants a small camera with high optical zoom and wide angle. The large touch screen makes it quite convenient to take and view photos. It also provides some built-in shooting situations that makes taking photos even more fun. And the silver case looks gorgeous! Love it!

Reviews.Title: neat little camera
Reviews.Author: greg r
Reviews.Content: I had just bought a new digital camera and my brother really liked it so he asked me to find a good one for him online. I looked around and after a couple weeks I decided on this one. The reason I got this one is because the price was right and it is a very good camera. He really likes it because it blows away his last camera and it is touch screen and the zoom was really good. He has no complaints about it and is really happy with it.Thank You.

Reviews.Title: Xmas present
Reviews.Author: T. Groh
Reviews.Content: got it as a lightening deal deal over the holidays for the wife - she LOVES IT!Wanted a purse sized camera with a decent zoom - hands down better than the little Nikkon she had - the photos are always clear now, even if accross the gym taking volleyball photos

Reviews.Title: Liked it at first but, caution, DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Luke & Cassi Hersey "herkens"
Reviews.Content: this really is an exceptional camera, the options are like a full size camera in a compact.  Here i my reservation, the battery dies way to quickly and the status indication is wildly off the actual time it will stay active.  My suggestion is by a third part power pack of the same size that has a much higher mA, there are a few on amazon that are highly rated that is a fraction of the cost of its Cannon counter part.Edit:We had this for not never 6 months and I was sitting on a stoop and I was taking pictures and was holding the camera not even 6 inces off the ground when I dropped it and it landed on the corner of the unit.  After turning back on the LCD cracked part way, that happens but the surprising thing was the lens zoom came off the track and now displays a lens error.I called Cannon customer service and they were super nice and said they will look at it at the service center.  They got it a week later and said that any time there is any sign of accidental damage that warranty will not be covered, AND SENT ME A QUOTE FOR $160!!!I understand if they said the lcd was not covered but the lens should not have come off the track like that after a 6 inch drop.  I will never buy Cannon again.

Reviews.Title: incredible quality
Reviews.Author: 5424jer
Reviews.Content: We took this camera on our trip to Disneyland, and I thought the pictures were every bit as good as what I get from my dSLR.  Incredible lens, fairly good in low light.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera for the price...
Reviews.Author: Dennis L. Moore "maximus98"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, pics are great, touchscreen on back is a delight!  Like color too!  Wide angle lens does a great job...I like to photograph marching bands.

Reviews.Title: canon elph 510 hs
Reviews.Author: sac
Reviews.Content: Very good camera, lots of features, I bought mine a year ago and  I am very happy with it, pictures are really nice easy to work the many functions, and is very nice looking camera you can do almost anything with this camera

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera for the money!
Reviews.Author: Angler2
Reviews.Content: I got this for my roadtrips and camping trips. I've taken some really long distance shots and the focus is really stable. The pictures on the "Vivid" setting are crazy good!!! The quality of photos are almost always on the mark. The only thing this camera lags on is no Panoramic setting. Outside of that, it's the best camera I've ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 510 HS 12.1 MP
Reviews.Author: Mordechai Scheinfeld "moty"
Reviews.Content: My son had a camera but wasn't happy with it. I have bought other Canon cameras and liked them. This one also very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Amazing
Reviews.Author: Katelynn Glenn
Reviews.Content: If I could give this camera more stars, I would. This camera was a Christmas gift for my mom and she absolutely loves it! There are so many neat features to the camera...like color swapping, color accenting, fish eye and lots of others. The shutter speed is very fast. The touch screen is very nice and the camera is very simple to use. My mother is not tech-savvy and she has no problem operating this camera. This was a great find and for an amazing price!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Erin
Reviews.Content: I like all the features and the ease of use!It's compact size is great because I can slip it in my purse.

Reviews.Title: Happy camper
Reviews.Author: Bill T "Bill T"
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with this camera. It's very small and lightweight but takes very good pictures. Thanks for this product.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good little camera
Reviews.Author: Carol G. Ball
Reviews.Content: The only thing it can't do that my old Elph did was to adjust the flash to be on all the time, to fill in.  Otherwise, nice wide angle lens, takes great photos!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: David E. Bohl "Pagosa Dave"
Reviews.Content: This camera was ordered to replace an earlier version that my wife had lost. The camera is fantastic! My features that did not exist on the earlier model.

Reviews.Title: Great deal!
Reviews.Author: Hieu D. Nguyen "Free Flying Forever"
Reviews.Content: The camera was worth the price. It is quite light weight with small size and big lens.I would love to have the Memory Card included in the deal as well, but it it no big deal.

Reviews.Title: Typical Canon Excellence
Reviews.Author: John W. Hadbavny
Reviews.Content: It does everything I need it to do. Lives up to its positive image per reviews I read before purchase.J W Hadbavny,  Georgia

Reviews.Title: Takes amazing pictures
Reviews.Author: M Salazar
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera about a year now and it takes amazing pictures.  We initially bought it because of the great review this camera got in Consumer Reports magazine.  It has several modes that you can use to take beautiful, creative photos.  And it takes amazing photos in low light. We've owned several point and click cameras, but this one is by far the best.  The battery lasts a long time.  I love it better than my DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Love it i just need to get use to the screen it is very touchie, the battery life seems short so make sure you get extras

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: David Heli Parrado Clavijo
Reviews.Content: EL PRODUCTO LLEGO OK, TAL Y COMO LO OFRECIERON ESTOY TOTALMENTE SATISFECHO CON EL MISMO.RECOMIENDO AL VENDEDOR ES BASTANTE RESPONSABLE

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot Camera
Reviews.Author: sh
Reviews.Content: The perfect camera for any occasion.  This camera is very compact, yet it takes awesome pictures.  It has a great zoom for such a small camera.  It was exactly what I was looking for to take pictures of my family and my children during their sports events.

Reviews.Title: Sleek and quick
Reviews.Author: Jamie Davis
Reviews.Content: Product arrived quickly and in perfect condition.  Camera is excellent with quick shutter time, which makes a huge difference to me above other cameras.  Highly recommended buy.

Reviews.Title: Taking pictures at any distance seems to make picture unfocused
Reviews.Author: Evelyn J. Mayblum "Evelyn J. Mayblum"
Reviews.Content: my review is the title. Beautiful shots if closer up...but not at a distance. Would look for something similar in price but better at further away shots.

Reviews.Title: Camera for wife
Reviews.Author: Eugene Oxender
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted a small,compact camera at a reasonable price.  And ,one that was easy to operate.  The battery life between charging far exceeds her previous camera.This camera fit her requirements, perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Grammie
Reviews.Content: Sometimes it's frustrating with all of the languages to page through and find English.But, this little camera is pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: A great camera for all your needs
Reviews.Author: Shawn Beem
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to purchase this camera because of reviewers saying that it had a poor battery life.  I've experienced that with another Canon and it was a real pain to always charge the battery.  But, I took a chance.  I have NO problem with the length of time the battery lasts.  I took this camera with us this Summer on our road trip and it would last a full day, no problem.  I didn't shoot a lot of video, so maybe that it when the battery life is shortened.  The photos are crisp and bright and the HD video from this camera is crisp and clear.  I won't be lugging a video camera anywhere with my anymore.  I love this camera and am very happy with the purchase, and the price!  I recommended it to a friend after she saw the video I took on my vacation, and she bought the same one for her European vacation.

Reviews.Title: snapshots
Reviews.Author: hwang
Reviews.Content: LOVE that it's a touchscreen and so easy to use! Dropped it once but it survived! Had it been a 14mp it would have been perfect but 12mp isn't bad either! the optical is the best part! it can zooom very very close and perfect when i bought just in time for graduation

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jersee11
Reviews.Content: I will hopefully never test its waterproof capabilities.  I purchased the camera in case of that accidental plunge into the pool with it in my pocket.  The photos are top notch.  The intelligent setting is excellent.  Could not be happier!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: bnlusa "bnlusa"
Reviews.Content: Anyone that does not want to spend too much money on a camera but wants a very good camera and something light and small would love this Canon PowerShot ELPH 510 HS camera.It works great, it is easy to use, small, light weight and takes great pictures.  All the things I need in a camera.

Reviews.Title: Rated great
Reviews.Author: Raymond Gallop
Reviews.Content: This camera was rated better then the New one that replaced it and I think the same this phone is great and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: Paul Cancialosi
Reviews.Content: Actually this camera was a gift for my wife to take on a vacation to Florida.  She found that this camera takes great pictures and was easy to use. Also, because it is slim in size, it easily fits inside one of the compartments in her purse.

Reviews.Title: Canon Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann T. Kline "madje76"
Reviews.Content: At first, I didn't like this camera, but then I downloaded the user manual and started looking for help.  I like this camera a lot.  You can do so many different things with it, which I haven't even touched upon.  The only complaint I have is I can't get the carry-strap through the small hole on the side.  But, I will eventually as I have tiny crochet hooks which can help out.

Reviews.Title: perfect camera for me
Reviews.Author: MikesMom "MikesMom"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this on the advice of a friend of a friend who travels into jungles and shoots wildlife.  this is a very handy camera for a woman and it takes great pictures.  Easy to operate.  Ability to correct lighting before and after shooting.  Large viewing area so you can really see what you're shooting AND you can bring it way up close before the click! This is a very nice camera.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Antony
Reviews.Content: Great Camera For A Beginner... Touch Screen Is A Little Off Which Is Why There's 4 Stars Instead Of 5... Other Than That, It's Perfect For Me...

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Manoj
Reviews.Content: Pretty good for the price!! Picture quality is great, battery lasts long enough. Good image stabilizer. Works for me. Nice!

Reviews.Title: Great pics & great features.
Reviews.Author: gg513
Reviews.Content: This camera takes really god pics, and has a lot of great features. Like the rapid shooting for capturing action shots. I wish the battery lasted longer tho.

Reviews.Title: Battery life makes this camera a poor choice.
Reviews.Author: RpG
Reviews.Content: The camera has some nice features and takes good photos.  The zoom is superior to many similar cameras.  Battery life however makes this camera not very functional.  A day out with the family leaves you wondering if the battery will last.  Much worse than last Canon camera that I owned.

Reviews.Title: okay but not for me!
Reviews.Author: casual camera user
Reviews.Content: I purchased this because I was looking for a compact, travel, long zoom, digital camera with point and shoot capability along with some manual controls.  I wanted a camera I could carry in my pocket that had at least 10X optical zoom capability.  After comparing several models and reading several reviews I settled on the ELPH 510 HS.  I used this for one vacation trip to Disney.  It took good quality photos outside but was disappointing for indoor flash photos when set to intelligent auto mode.  In low light conditions the intelligent auto setting would produce poor quality photos and would pick an ISO setting that gives you a camera shake warning every time.  After contacting Canon support they said that the auto mode shouldn't be used for every situation.  To produce the best photos in certain conditions the program mode should be used to pick the best setting.  Well, when you are traveling and going from outside bright sun to indoor conditions remembering to change the settings gets old and fumbling with the settings can lead to you missing some photo opportunities.  I think the camera should at least take acceptable pictures in all conditions when using the intelligent auto mode.  Maybe I'm asking too much.  I decided the camera was not for me and returned it.

Reviews.Title: powershot
Reviews.Author: hangyu
Reviews.Content: This canon powershot ELPH 510 is a good deal and it deserves the money. The red color looks nice, and it is easy to hold.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Samantha
Reviews.Content: I love love love this product. I got it as a lightning deal on amazon and couldn't ask for a better camera. totally worth it. the only con is sometimes it can be hard to touch the screen but other than that...PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: canon power shot
Reviews.Author: arjun
Reviews.Content: my brother gifted me this camera on my birthday.firstly, it looks great with nice pictures and when we upload them into pc the picture quality varies it looks dull. I tried all settings and it didn't work out. Its not worth buying.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot ELPH 510 camera
Reviews.Author: high flyer
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my new Canon camera. We wanted a small camera with all of these features and this one is great. The display is crisp and clear and the photos and videos are very good.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera!
Reviews.Author: Just Peachy
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 6 week trip to France and it was amazing!I was searching for cameras for a few weeks and Amazon had this amazing deal where it was only $150, but I had to buy it that day.Sold. After reading many reviews about the ELPH cameras, I was worried about the battery life. Seriously, it was no problem at all.The battery did die after 2 straight hours of my dad trying to figure out all of the intricacies. But I took the camera on a 3 day trip to London (forgot the charger) and didn't need it! I took about 200+ photos and a ton of videos. The battery died just as I was heading on the train back to France.The one thing that REALLY drains the battery is the touch-screen click feature. This camera lets one take a picture just by touching the screen (Like Ashton Kutcher does in the commercial.) Honestly, I don't really see the need for it, so I turned it off in the settings. Saves a lot of battery-life as well as wasted photos, like accidental purse pictures.Image quality is fantastic. Shoots wonderful videos. Photos easily transferable to the computer. So much nicer to carry around than the DSLRs I was looking at.All in all, a wonderful camera. Durable too.I'm going to end this review with my brother's advice to my battery hesitations. "If you need more than one battery for a camera, you're taking too many pictures."****This rule does not apply to photographers.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Avery
Reviews.Content: The retail price is listed fairly high but I snagged mine for $160. It was worth every penny and I would recommend this to anyone looking to spend up to $200 on a small sleek camera for hd video, normal picture taking, and picture taking on images zoomed in.The video quality is very good and transfers easy to the computer. There is minimal lag time turning on and inbetween shots. I use mine only about once a week, but never have problems with it.My only warning however is the touch screen. This is a screen you actually have to press on with a small amount of force, unlike the heat detection touchscreens that apple makes. You can't click through this in a big hurry, however you won't need to use the touchscreen very much under normal use.

Reviews.Title: Cannon ELPH510
Reviews.Author: ruby_shops
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. the touch screen feature is perfect and pictures come out really great.Would highly recommend this cannon touch screen camera!!Missing a star, because it doesn't come with a camera case.

Reviews.Title: Canon Digital
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: After buying this camera I've only had opportunity to use it a little, but I'm already so very pleased with its picture quality.  I'll have an opportunity to use it extensively beginning this month.  So far, It is great!

Reviews.Title: Good P&S;, but doesn't quite measure up to the Lumix GF3
Reviews.Author: Lisa Jasinski
Reviews.Content: This fall, I set out to replace a beloved three-year old Lumix point and shoot. I decided to try the ELPH 510 because it has high end specs and was an especially good deal on Amazon. I also purchased a Lumix GF3, a micro four thirds camera.The first thing you'll notice about this camera is its small size. In fact, I had to be very careful until my hands adjusted to its near weightless feel -- I almost felt like I was going to drop it. My hunch is that some men (with larger hands) might not like the size because it requires a light touch. This little camera will most certainly slip into your pocket and you'll never have to think twice about packing it, especially when space and weight counts.In general, the camera takes nice photos. The resolution is high and the images are sharp.  The zoom is particularly impressive and there are lots of fun "filters" that allow you to take black and white shots, a simulated fisheye lens, or other settings (like sunset mode). The main reason I returned the item to Amazon is because I was more impressed with the Lumix GF3, a micro four-thirds system with a detachable lens and greater manual features that I was trying out at the same time. To be fair, the Lumix is a different kind of camera and it's more expensive, so it's not a true peer-to-peer comparison.When I did a side-by-side comparison, the Lumix out performed the Canon in low-light, in macro-mode, and also captured richer, warmer colors. Images with the Canon were sharp all around -- but the Lumix offers a better depth of field (the subject in the foreground is sharp, but the background is blurry).  The ELPH has an incredibly powerful zoom and outperformed the Lumix.One thing I do not like about the Canon is that it flashes a bright orange light before it takes a photo.  I think that this feature is annoying and it makes it nearly impossible to take candids.  I'd also be self-conscious of shooting in certain circumstances.The Canon gets lousy reviews on battery life, which doesn't seem surprising.  The rechargeable battery is the size of 1 AA and it has to light up a 3" touchscreen.  All of the reviewers suggested picking up a spare.  Amazon offers many of them in the $10-$20 range.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 510 --- Great purchase!
Reviews.Author: jacharles
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera just before a vacation, and it performed marvelously. I had researched it and asked the advice of a friend, and the price on Amazon was MUCH less than elsewhere.  We were surprised at how well low-light photos turned out when we tried them with the flash turned off. The zoom is terrific. Just a couple of drawbacks: 1) Several times I clicked the on/off button instead of the shutter button by mistake (right next to one another), I guess because I was so engrossed in setting up the shot that I didn't notice that my finger had moved. 2) The user manual is huge and only comes in PDF format, and as I did not have time to read through the whole thing before we went on vacation, some of the less-intuitive features I was unable to use, such as the self-timer.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Tony "Tony"
Reviews.Content: it was on sale for $159.99 one day and it was purchased for a graduation present. it takes good pictures and a good overall point and shoot camera. it's slim and the coolest feature is it's a touch screen in the back.

Reviews.Title: Just Amazing!!!
Reviews.Author: New Yorker
Reviews.Content: This small little camera is simply awesome. Both the picture and video quality is top-notch. The touch screen is very easy to use once you get used to it. I strongly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: gift for son
Reviews.Author: charzweb
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son and he couldn't be happier.  The only thing about it is that is that it's small and my son tends to be hard on electronics, so I made sure I bought the warranty.  He loves the camera and used it from the day he got it.

Reviews.Title: Marvelous camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Bennett
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item for my granddaughter who is going to China for her high school junior year in 2012-2013.  She and I took the camera out for a test and trial run, and it does everything perfectly that she anticipates needing for her trip.  It is small, with fine optics, and picture quality.  I had a little trouble with the touch screen controls, but being a young person she didn't.  This is a great camera for most needs, especially travel.

Reviews.Title: crisp beautiful pics
Reviews.Author: Shawn S Gruenig
Reviews.Content: Even though I haven't quite figured out all the wonders of this camera, the weekend I purchased it I took fabulous pictures at my niece's wedding.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: C. Hayhoe "chayhoe"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use with wonderful clear pictures.  Best little camera out there. Just the right size for your pocket to carry everywhere.

Reviews.Title: camera for trip
Reviews.Author: cartechsteve
Reviews.Content: Very prompt delivery for a great price..Camera takes great pictures. Also is very user friendly.....The 1080p video also works very good..look forward to more purchases from Amazon...

Reviews.Title: The Best Canon
Reviews.Author: speedway
Reviews.Content: This camera use CMOS matrix like DSLR cameras, have 12x optical and fullHD, so this is the best camera for this price

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Bernie D
Reviews.Content: This camera is lightweight and easy to carry and use.  It takes great pictures and very clear close ups.  I have taken hundreds of photos with it in the short time I've owned it and the only complaint I have is the time it takes to actually take the picture sometimes....the shutter can be tricky at times.

Reviews.Title: A Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Brian Carlson
Reviews.Content: The touch screen takes some getting used to. The battery needs to be recharged after just a short time. I bought 4 additional batteries just to be able to use the camera. It takes good pictures and is light weight.

Reviews.Title: Great compact digital camera
Reviews.Author: Thomascaol Com
Reviews.Content: I had owned a Nikon previously that had a pop up flash.  I loved the camera, but the pop up flash would get in the way of holding the camera and twice "broke" and would not pop up.  I purchased the ELPH 510 because it had everything my other camera had plus a little more with a built in fixed flash.  VERY happy with the new camera.

Reviews.Title: Not user friendly
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M. Rudolph "Jen Rudolph "greenma...
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I am on a budget and the price was right.  I had to replace my Lumix, which I loved but this got good ratings and was a better price.  I have not gotten a good picture of my 2 year old son with it yet and it has been a year.  Every single one has closed eyes or is blurry.  I read the manual a million times, changed the setting to "kids and pets" to no avail.  I am not tech saavy and just wanted a camera that is easy to use.  I have given it to friends to play with, they get the same result. I wish someone would be able to tell me how to use it.  If anyone has advice, I appreciate it!

Reviews.Title: Incredibly fragile
Reviews.Author: CF
Reviews.Content: Took good pictures, nice zoom lens, but start up time and time to auto focus were extremely long. Dropped it just one time-from a coffee table to the carpeted floor-and the view screen cracked and became unusable. SquareTrade said it was not fixable, and paid me the value of the policy. If you do buy one of these camera, I strongly recommend that you immediately purchase an accident protection warranty.

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: Luis Cantu Saldivar
Reviews.Content: Only worked once for a few minutes, I am very disappointed, very bad product. Do not buy it and luck if you do

Reviews.Title: Nice one
Reviews.Author: DD
Reviews.Content: I have gifted this camera to my friend and he was happy to have this. He said its very good and the clarity are good.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, but protect its back screen.
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: Served me well for 2 years and then somehow the screen on the back got cracked in my purse. Can still point and click but have no idea if it is taking the shot I want or in focus...

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Sexy Senior
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It is easy to use.  Battery charge lasts for months.  Down loading the pictures to my computer is quick.

Reviews.Title: AUTO ROTATE STUCK ON, WILL NOT TURN OFF, BRAND NEW, 1 HOUR OLD
Reviews.Author: tracy fladseth
Reviews.Content: Turning-off the auto rotate does nothing, it is defective right out of the box.  I don't have time to rotate each photo when I'm working fast! I bought this for Ebay listing. Auto rotate is my living nightmare! I will never understand why these new cameras do this...even when all my subjects are the same size and I'm always shooting horizontal. Really? You're going to rotate this one clockwise and this next one counter clockwise, totally at random for no reason? AND IT IS NOT MY COMPUTER. My old camera works fine if I turn the Auto Rotate off... I have bought 3 new cameras: one worked fine (Powershot SX510), but the lens ring came off. I bought two more and they did not even have auto rotate. This one does, but when you turn it off, it does nothing. I'm going to re-buy another SX510 and hope for the best.The touch-screen MENU and FUNCTION is horrible, it will not let you scroll properly, instead it selects the first thing your finger touches, even if you are doing it fast, in a swiping motion. I messed around with all the functions a bit before returning and this camera is a pain in the butt to configure. Hate it.

Reviews.Title: Most Frustrating Camera
Reviews.Author: meed
Reviews.Content: Before I bought this Canon camera, I owned Sony and Olympus and was very happy with.  I heard so much good things about Canon and I bought this ELPH510 just to found out the most unfriendly and frustrating camera.I have never succeeded to really used correctly and I have it for over a year.I will not buy it again

Reviews.Title: Good one
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Capture all your special moments with this camera and cherish the memories over and over again. Super image processor, this camera lets you take smooth, detailed, and high-quality images. The monitor on this Canon makes it easy to view photos, read menu, and compose shots. With a high ISO sensitivity.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Y Ann
Reviews.Content: I'm in love with this camera. I won't go into details about picture quality ; there are examples all over the Internet. And of course the S95's 720 HD video is a big improvement

Reviews.Title: Overall a good compact camera
Reviews.Author: Edwin V. Cooksey
Reviews.Content: I find the software overly complicated and unless I use it very frequently have to go back to the manual for a review.  The zoom is quite adequate and the photos excellent.  The touch screen is not difficult to use.  The reason I bought it is for it's size, weight, price and telephoto lens.  Overall, it's a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon ELPH 510
Reviews.Author: CRAIG
Reviews.Content: Having other Canon products this performed as expected-great. Battery life was a little less than expected so I bought a second battery.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Rosemary M. Moors
Reviews.Content: This was not hard to set up and so far - pics are AWESOME! It is compact and carries well.

Reviews.Title: very disappointed
Reviews.Author: J. Li
Reviews.Content: I ordered one in January 2012, and only used it lightly.  In July, when we were on our vacation, out of no reason, the lense didn't work.  So I sent to the Canon repair center.  I was told it should be repaired in 7 working days.  Now it is 21 working days and they are still waiting for parts.  Last week I called the repair center, they told me it should be done in a week.  A week later, I called again, and I was told that it should be done in a week.  I never expected to have a CANON camera that would break in just 6 months (not to mention I only used very lightly).  I never expected that CANON service is so bad as well.  I guess I will never buy CANON in the future!

Reviews.Title: Keep Looking for your sure shot!
Reviews.Author: JulianB.
Reviews.Content: The service provided by Amazon was flawless as usual but this product with the touch screen was less than perfect, its kinda like a IPad wannabe but unfortunately isnt so stick the the IPad for Ipad functions and with a camera for camera functions.This was a poor attempt at combining the two. Touch function was frustrating at times to work with and battery life was less than most.

Reviews.Title: 10 minute video recording Limit ! and 20 Minutes will drain your battery completely.
Reviews.Author: J. Mo
Reviews.Content: Summary: If you are looking for a camera to record more than 10 minutes of video continuously, look else where.For me specifically I was looking for a camera (and I'm a Canon fan) that as the fast zoom lens, the chance to go wide angle, and the video recording ability as long as the memory card has space and the battery is still good.I found out that when I was trying to record a speech or event, I put the camera on the tripod and let her rip. Well it shuts down in 10 minutes exactly, every time!  That's my deal breaker right there.  I returned the camera and got my refund.  I thought by putting in a 32GB SD card that I would be set to be able to record an hour easily.
