I was also expecting the battery to last at least an hour.I also found out with a brand new battery that after 20 minutes of recording (2 x 10 minutes recording), the battery was almost dead and the battery is expensive, so I would have to buy 3 or 4 batteries, another deal breaker.Side note: I miss the ability to use AA.  I am willing to sacrifice size to being able to use AA.  I wish companies would keep a line of new products that sticked with AA batteries.  If you know of a really good point and shoot camera that can do 1080P videos for more than 60 minutes and uses AA batteries, please let me know.

Reviews.Title: ridiculous wifi
Reviews.Author: Ted
Reviews.Content: one of the reasons I bought this was the ease of transferring files onto your computers, without a cable, but using wifi. --- this sounds lazy but without having to spend the little effort to connect the cable, I find myself saving files much more often using my cellphone camera + dropbox.I tried the wifi connector, the camera takes > 3 minutes to find my home wifi access point (by all means it's a strong wifi AP, and my computer finds it in no more than 10 seconds). once connected to wifi, I let the camera connect to my PC, and the camera does appear as an "Other device" on control panel of windows. but within 10 seconds, the connection is dropped, and the device disappears. All the on-going imports failed. this is really nasty user experience, did Canon software engineers ever QA their product before release???the screen is not so user friendly. having been accustomed to the intuitive and responsive experience on smart phones, I find this "touch screen" to be like going back to the 1990's. first of all it's made with old, cheap , resistive touch screen, not the currently standard capacitive touch screen used on all modern smartphones

Reviews.Title: Not User Friendly
Reviews.Author: Linda R. Hendrex "Rubicon"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because my trusty Kodak Easy Share bit the dust.  I am not used to gadgets that are smarter than I am and this little camera almost has me beat.  It is so difficult to work with and I miss so much because I am struggling with my camera!And when I finally do get some good photos and videos, forget sharing them to Facebook, YouTube or any other online social network.  My computer doesn't like the photos that are taken with this camera, Facebook doesn't like photos that are taken with this camera, and YouTube doesn't like videos that are taken with this camera.  What a waste.The photos themselves are good quality, but what good are they if they will not upload, print out or email?  If you want something that is trouble free, please keep looking.  This is not the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: THE BIG RED POCKET CANON!  Pun intended.
Reviews.Author: Death4u
Reviews.Content: Ladies, Gentlemen, what kind of camera do you want?  Would you like a nikon, panasonic, sony, olympus?  Or would you prefer:  THE BIG RED POCKET CANON!!!  THATS RIGHT, let me whip this out real quick.  Stand back, this bad boy will put your eye out.  Ok, I could keep going... forever... but I want to get slightly serious and tell you about this camera.  First, DO NOT GET THE RED CAMERA.  It is not the same color red as in the picture.  It looks washed out this color makes the camera look plastic in person.  I'm sure the black or silver would look much nicer.  Second, if you are looking for a camera to stick in your pocket, try a smaller canon. This camera's super vivid mode makes for some amazing pictures.  The display looks great, this camera's massive touch screen is probably the reason it drains batteries like there is no tomorrow.  Seriously bring TWO or THREE extra batteries...  Kind of ridiculous how quick it dies.  Trade off, because it looks sick!  Touch screen not sensitive and at times it is hard to push the right areas accurately on the screen.  The photo's are nice crisp and clear so that is the main thing.  The 12X zoom is awesome and the main reason I bought this camera.  All in all I would say this is a good camera, but the touch screen is not worth the extra money in my opinion the ELPH 310 is a better deal an probably a lot more compact.  This is a sweet camera though with more features than I will ever need or learn how to use.  Before I leave you a couple things more things about the camera.  Obviously the Big Red Pocket Canon is fun to play with. The Big Pocket Canon shoots in bursts, so fast you might think it's scary... etc etc filthy joke.  Ok ok I'm done.l put up a few pictures for you guys an girls so you can see what I am getting.  I think most are on AF.  With an old lousy memory card.  I just bought a new memory card to see if high speed cards actually do make a noticeable difference in photos.  Take care everyone.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Iron Knight
Reviews.Content: Works fine, got here on schedule.  I like it. It takes good pictures and is small enough to carry around with me.

Reviews.Title: Must Have pocket camera
Reviews.Author: J. Bradt
Reviews.Content: Excellent pics with powerful optical zoom in a small package.  Touch screen allows quick adjustments to composition that decrease the need to doctor pics after downloading.

Reviews.Title: buyer
Reviews.Content: I received this item without any memory card, as a result i can't take no pictures or video it's a useless item

Reviews.Title: Poor excuse for a camera that does video
Reviews.Author: G. Carlson
Reviews.Content: I'm just sick.  Received my camera, took a few pictures than videoed my daughtersdance routine at this summers dance camp.  Downloaded sd card to my computer, got thepictures fine.  No videos!!  Red button flashed like it was videoing, but no videoon the sd card.
